snippet: Prosecutors said Michael Meneses used stolen passwords to cause mayhem and cost his former Long Island employer more than $90,000 after he was passed over for promotions.
abstract: Federal prosecutors accuse Michael Meneses, former software programmer at Spellman High Voltage Electronics Corporation, of hacking into company's computer system after he was passed over for promotion, costing company more than $90,000; Meneses faces up to 10 years in prison if convicted.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors said Michael Meneses used stolen passwords to cause mayhem and cost his former Long Island employer more than $90,000 after he was passed over for promotions.

headline.seo: Ex-Programmer Pleads Not Guilty in Long Island Computer Hacking Case
headline.main: Ex-Worker Created Havoc With Hacking, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Ex-Worker Created Havoc With Hacking, U.S. Says
